bibl.title: Translation [from Spanish] of a contract between Ignacio Rojas and Demetrio Zunzunegui, April 1, 1907

div1.p: Rojas rents the lime kilns and quarries on his San Jose farm to Zunzunegui, who may occupy the two small wooden houses.

div1.head: Translation [from Spanish] of a contract between Ignacio Rojas and Demetrio Zunzunegui, April 1, 1907
div1.opener:
DR. IGNACIO ROJAS,
M. D. & Dental Surgeon,
Bernaza No. 36. Tel. No. 3012
H A B A N A.
div1.p:
In the city of Havana on the first day of April of the
year Nineteen Hundred and Seven (1907): on the one part Dr. Ignacio
Rojas, as power-of-attorney of his wife, Señora Maria Teresa Lomas,
and of the other part Sr. Demetrio Zunzunegui, have contracted and
agreed as follows:
FIRST: Dr. Ignacio Rojas rents to Sr. Demetrio Zunzunegui from
today until December 31, 1909, the Limekilns and the limestone
quarries which exist in the Finca San José situated in the Muni-
cipal Terminus of Marianao, district of “Los Quemados”, which he
may operate for the industry referred, taking care to keep them in
a good state of conservation; likewise the well close to the lime-
kilns, the water from which he may make use.
SECOND: The taxes and contributions also whatever investment which
may have to be made for these industries or consequent thereto, shall
be for account of Sr. Zunzunegui.
THIRD: The land at his disposal shall be that only included in the
quarries already started and that occupied by the lime-kilns and the
well, amounting to four to six acres, permitting the animals which
may be kept on the farm (finca) to drink water, if necessary, from
that which the limekilns have for their use.
FOURTH: The tenant may occupy the two small wooden houses which are
close to the limekilns, maintaining them in good condition.
FIFTH: The passage or road to his industries shall be that which
exists between the limekilns and the Calzada (highway), leaving by
the main portal or gate, which portal and road, to the curb, should
be kept clean and in good condition.
SIXTH: Should Sr. Zunzunegui install tubing for water from the
Albear Canal for the limekilns, he shall install a half inch pipe
to supply the main house (the family residence), even though same
may not be used nor necessary.
SEVENTH: The necessary fences for the animals (Live stock) which may
be kept on the farm shall be for account of the tenant, so far as the
limekilns and quarries are concerned.
EIGHTH: All betterments and improvements which may be made shall
remain for the benefit of the farm, without any indemnity.
NINTH: The rental shall be TWENTY-SEVEN PESOS AND FIFTY CENTS in
gold for each one month, payable quarterly in advance. Failure to make
a quarterly payment, opportunely, shall be cause sufficient to cancel
this contract.
TENTH: It will be indispensable that the cartmen, employees and all
others who pass through to the limekilns and its adjuncts, observe the
good conduct and consideration due the neighbors, without offending
the ears with bad words.
ELEVENTH: Passage will be forbidden from without to within the farm
except in the manner indicated, likewise from within to without
except by the road referred to.

And so that they may be duly complimented, we make two equal
copies which we hereby sign.

closer.signed:
(Signed) DEMETRIO ZUNZUNEGUI (there is a flourish)
(Signed) DR. IGNACIO ROJAS (there is a flourish)
